My expectations for this movie couldn't have been lower, but I was swept off my feet by this charming little flick. My reluctant 15-year-old son even enjoyed it beyond his wildest expectations. My 12-year-old daughter was an easy sell, but we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Alicia Silverstone was the only real disappointment, and it seemed such a shame to waste a good role on a performer of such limited talent. The rest of the cast was excellent, and I wholeheartedly recommend this movie.

Blast From the Past was such a cute and heartwarming film that leaves you with a comforting feeling inside. I thought Brendan Frasier was perfect for the part, although Alicia Silverstone's acting wasn't the best. I think it was very realistic, yet comical, and was a pleasing change from the ordinary movie plot. I give Blast From the Past a 9/10!

reviews.review_title: It's the end of the world ... and I can see it coming
reviews.content: Vaguely enjoyable pap that is saved from the utter predictability of its plot and the sickeningly sweet ending by great performances from the ever-reliable Christopher Walken and Sissy Spacek. The film does in fact start promisingly as a kind of skit or satire on cold war paranoia in America of the early 1960s. The period design of the sets and the costumes capture the age well and Walken and Spacek are outstanding However as the story develops, the romantic comedy between the two main characters (Adam and Eve!)begins to grate.Their relationship has none of the spark a romantic comedy needs and really one couldn't care less about the characters who are two dimensional. In a way it is perfect to watch with mum and dad and it does have some laugh out loud moments. However this film has little soul and is poorly scripted... I winced as Alicia Silverstone's gay best friend counselled Adam: 'You're a nice boy ... now it is time to be a nice man'. Undoubtedly well made, the cliché-ridden plot and at times dubious values (often straight out of the Eisenhower manual for nuclear families) had me cringing and shouting at the screen

reviews.review_title: Eve finds Adam in East L.A.
reviews.content: Eve (Silverstone) is jaded, never met a guy who wasn't a schmuck. Adam (Fraser) is an adorable, handsome, polished gentleman right out of a Norman Rockwell Saturday Evening Post cover, who pops into her life and shows her something she thought impossible: A Nice Guy.It takes Eve's gay roommate to notice the obvious - this guy is for real. He uses 'Ipana' toothpaste. He has $50k worth of mint condition 1940-50s baseball cards. He speaks fluent French and German.There are so many delightful, beautiful wow-moments in this movie that I suggest that reviewers who complain that it's 'not consistently funny' try The Three Stooges or Benny Hill.This is a marvelous movie. Sissy Spacek and Christopher Walken are priceless as perfectly preserved 1950s suburbanites. I've watched it several times over the years, and will again. Highly Recommended.

Give me back my 100 minutes. I stopped caring when they were still underground. The male lead is a Tom Hanks wanna be. But far from it. Ugh Bad.No believable chemistry between Adam and Eve. He is a dope, she is just unattractive (personality-wise) and also funny looking with her whacko perm and dimestore makeup job.The nightclub scene was so completely far fetched. He has only had human interaction with his parents for 35 years. He learns to dance with his Mom in a basement so of course he walks into a 90s Swing nightclub and starts throwing and twirling 2 babes in the air at once. Oh, and the 'clever' line that gets her attention is "have you seen my Congressional Medal of Honor, I think I dropped it in here?"My God, don't these filmmakers know that they shoot people for saying things that lame to women in LA!!!The ONLY thing that was cool was the props and set design. Lots of funky space age stuff form the 50s and 60s, but the plot and most of the acting were so bad, so so bad.

I went to see this movie, expecting not to like it very much.  Was I ever pleasantly suprised!  This movie is hysterical.  Dave Foley is absolutely wonderful as Troy, and, although Frasier's performance is at times wooden, every so often he says a line with absolute comic perfection.  The whole sub-plot with the junkie in the restaurant defies description.  You just have to see it to understand, and you'll be glad if you do.  A must see, if you want to laugh your head off!

What a boring movie.  The timing was extremely slow, sometimes dwelling on un-funny moments that made me feel sorry for the movie in the same way one pities a bad comedian.  Some of these involved a cult worshipping (why?) the retro-family, some involved Silverstone's gay friend, some involved Fraser's parents.  Nothing in the movie made me laugh.  The only really captivating scene in the movie involves Fraser dancing at a club like he's been trained by a pro.  (He says he's taken a dancing lesson every day of his life.  He has, from his mother.  Where did SHE learn to dance like that?)Don't waste your time with this one unless you just think Fraser and Silverstone are too good-looking to miss.  They do make a handsome couple, but not enough to liven up this ho-hum movie.

Basically a "one-joke" comedy, this film varies between being very funny (such as the elevator scenes) and boring (the nightclub scene, just an excuse to stage a dance number).  For the director, however, it was a vast improvement over one of his previous efforts, the utterly dumb, man-bashing 'First Wives' Club".

I dont usually write reviews but i have to say what an underrated romantic comedy. I really loved alicia Silverstone in this. Brendan fraiser is pretty hilarious in this. Loved the ending as well. Even if your not into romantic comedies. I believe You'll still enjoy this because its pretty funny.

A very funny film, especially the gay jokes with Dave Foley.  Christopher Walken is excellent, as usual, and Brendan Fraser is also good.  The parts about the cult are very humorous ("Are you the son?") and the beginning with the jokes was hilarious.

When Romeo and Juliet meets time travel. Remove the brooding families, assassinations and, poisonings. Add a modern setting( late '80s early '90s vibes) with a funny twist. Also a hint of nostalgia. You now have a recipe for a great movie. When two worlds collide, the title says it all. If I could justify it I would give it a 9, so I guess you could say it's debatable. Kisses what a perfect movie should be like, if I was a movie doctor I would recommend this for a rainy day with some friends, ever better with a significant other.Amazing production value I saw this in 2022 still holds up. This movie left me wanting more. Familiar soundtrack with some songs you probably know by heart. Great acting, unbelievable cast. Brendan Fraser and Christopher Walken.....what more could you want? 2023 needs a movie like this, if there isn't one already.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to leave the theater
reviews.content: THis was one of the worst movies that I have ever seen.  I went with a friend and the two of us were in the mood for a cute and even kind of cheesy movie.  The ads made this movie look okay, and we were hoping that the movie was funnier than the commercial.  However, we were wrong.  THe movie was dull and lifeless.  The only funny part was the wierd guy that worshiped the family that lives underground, and he's not in the movie all that much. Halfway through the movie, I wanted to leave (something I have never done after paying $7.50), however I did not because I was hoping that the movie would miraculously become funny.  It never happened.  The only thing I can do now is warn people not to see this movie.  I hope I have done a good job.

As someone who goes to the cinema about once or twice a month I look for films I think will be to my taste, after all I go to be entertained. I thought this was a good film with some very funny moments. I loved Alicia Silverstone in this.I had a free ticket to see the film "Waking Ned" as it was called over here and I thought it was totally unfunny and would only class it as a TV movie to be seen when nothing better was on. Blast From The Past was much better.

I seek out movies like this. Great cast. Interesting concept. I am 51 years old so I am old enough to remember all the references to life in the 1950's and 1960's, but I have a lot of friends that are in their early 30's, so I could relate to the life of young adults in the 1990's. I might be the prime audience for this movie. In light of that, let me say this was a wonderful movie. It was clever and warm. I hated to see it end. Brendan Fraser is going to be a star for a long time. I think he is the next Tom Hanks.
